Home → Events and activities → Slaughter in Southwold

Slaughter in Southwold

Southwold Arts Centre, 15 - 16 June 2019

Meet and dine with top crime authors and enjoy a musical written by Sophie Hannah, murder mystery dinner written by Ann Cleeves, and crime-themed quiz night. Tickets available from TicketSource and Southwold Library.

Individual author talks £6; full day £18; Saturday + Sunday ticket £36. Lunch an additional £12 per day.

Saturday 15 June

Kate Ellis

1000–1115

Kate Ellis will be talking about her latest detective novel, The Boy Who Lived with the Dead, as well as her long-running DI Wesley Peterson series and Joe Plantagenet novels.

Mick Herron

1130–1245

Mick Herron will be talking about his award-winning Slough House novels, featuring the inimitable Jackson Lamb.

Lunch can be murder, with Cafe 51

1300

Have lunch, cake and hot drinks with top crime authors.

Jill Dawson

1400–1515

Jill Dawson will be talking about her new novel, The Language of Birds, a hypnotic novel about class, violence and friendship inspired by the shocking Lord Lucan case and the ‘lovely young nanny’ at its centre.

Val McDermid

1530–1645

Queen of Crime Val McDermid will be talking about her latest Karen Pirie novel, Broken Ground, and her other bestselling series.

Elementary My Dear Watson: fun crime quiz night

1900

Get together a team of 4 and take part in our fun quiz, with rounds on crime from TV, films and books, suitable for all.

Sunday 16 June

Mark Dawson

1000–1115

Mark Dawson will be talking about his bestselling John Milton, Beatrix Rose, Isabella Rose and Soho Noir series.

Martin Edwards

1130–1245

Martin Edwards will be talking about his latest thriller, Gallows Court, set in 1930, as well as his work as consultant on the British Library Crime Classics series.

Lunch: Something Fishy

1300–1400

Have lunch, cake and hot drinks with the authors visiting for Slaughter in Southwold.

Nicci French

1400–1515

Nicci French - AKA Sean French and Nicci Gerrard - will be discussing their bestselling Frieda Klein series, which recently concluded with Day of the Dead.

Felix Francis

1530–1645

Felix Francis will be talking about his latest novel, Crisis, and his other novels that continue his late father Dick Francis’ writing legacy.

Elly Griffiths

1700–1815

Elly Griffiths will be talking about her latest Dr Ruth Galloway novel, The Stone Circle.

Other events and activities

Murder Mystery Night: Bannocks and Blood, by Ann Cleeves

Fri 14 Jun, 1900

Help solve a murder mystery from the pen of Ann Cleeves, based on her bestselling Shetland books, and enjoy a Scottish meal from Café 51.
